intro: Sphaeranthus ovalis, commonly known as the oval spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, globular growth habit and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has fleshy, succulent leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powder. It thrives in dry, rocky environments and is often found in coastal areas. Sphaeranthus ovalis is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap.
